intro: Afropectinariella, commonly known as the African starwort, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and hairy stems, which are typical features of the Asteraceae family. The plant is native to various regions in Africa, where it thrives in dry and semi-arid environments. Afropectinariella species often have narrow, linear leaves and produce small, yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters. These plants are generally herbaceous and can be found in a variety of habitats, including rocky soils and open grasslands.
